intro: Arabis sophia, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock cabbage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Arabis sophia is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
